org.sd.text
Class TermFinder

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.text.AbstractPatternFinder
      org.sd.text.TermFinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
PatternFinder
public class TermFinder
extends AbstractPatternFinder

Utility to find a term from a (relatively small) set of terms in any arbitrarily-sized string.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getMatchFlag

public static final int getMatchFlag(java.lang.String matchFlag)
Convert a string from "sub", "prefix", "suffix", or "full" to its corresponding match (acceptPattern) flag.

loadTerms

public void loadTerms(java.io.File resourceFile)
               throws java.io.IOException
Load (add) terms to find from the resource file, one term per line.

Empty lines and comment lines (starting with '#') are ignored.

Each term will be normalized while loading.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

findPatternPos

public int[] findPatternPos(NormalizedString input,
                            int acceptPartial)
Find the position of a term within the (normalized) input.

Specified by:
findPatternPos in interface PatternFinder
Overrides:
findPatternPos in class AbstractPatternFinder
Returns:
an array with the normalized index of the first substring to match (at index 0), and its normalized length (at index 1) or null.

findPatternPos

public int[] findPatternPos(NormalizedString input,
                            int fromPos,
                            int toPos,
                            int acceptPartial)
Find a term between the fromPos (inclusive normalized position) and the toPos (exclusive normalized position).

Returns:
an array with the normalized index of the first substring to match (at index 0), and its normalized length (at index 1) or null.
